intro: Macairea aspera, commonly known as the rough macairea, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically pink or white. Macairea aspera is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
